content:
My apologies for the misunderstanding earlier. Here's a rewrite to reflect your instructions:

Tommy and Mark lay on the floor, deep in thought. Tommy spoke up first, "I can't believe it. I never knew him like this. I never knew he had to go through all of that."

Mark nodded in agreement, "It really puts things into perspective, doesn't it?"

Tommy continued, "All this time, I thought I was the only one. But he went through the same thing I did. It's like we're connected, even across time."

Mark smiled, "Yeah, and it's not just about bullies. We all have struggles and insecurities, and sometimes it feels like nobody understands. But now, we know that we're not alone."

Tommy sat up, "But what about going back? How do we figure out how long we've been gone? What time and day is it?"

Mark sat up next to him, "Good question. We need to make sure we don't raise suspicion or do anything that would mess up the timeline."

Tommy nodded in agreement, "Right. We have to be careful. But we need to find out, so we can make sure we get back without anyone noticing."

They sat in silence for a moment, before Tommy spoke up again, "I wonder if this is what my dad was trying to tell me. I always thought he was distant, but maybe he just didn't know how to express it."

Mark patted him on the back, "Maybe. But now, we can help each other. And who knows, maybe someday we'll be able to tell him everything."

Tommy smiled, "Yeah. Thanks, Mark. I'm glad we did this."

Mark grinned back, "Me too, buddy. Me too."

They got up from the floor and began to figure out how to get back to their own time.
